SaaS personal account
The SaaS personal account (instances for Software as a Service) is a special section of the site that allows users to:
create and manage projects and applications;
create teams to collaborate on projects;
purchase and manage licenses to expand the capabilities of the GreenData Low-code platform;
customize the
user profile
;
create and publish your own mobile applications in the
Google Play
and
App Store
stores based on project applications;
navigate to GreenData company resources such as the
Marketplace
,
platform documentation
, and
forum
;
contact the sales and technical support department specialists.
Getting Started
To explore the platform during the first authorization in the SaaS personal account, a modal window for creating the first project and application will be displayed.
This capability is provided based on a free
license
; the user only needs to specify names for the project and application, then click the "Create" button. Clicking the "Skip" button allows using this capability later.
The specified names can be changed later.
After clicking the "Create" button, a feature tour of the Account will be launched. By clicking "Next" in the pop-up hints, the user can familiarize themselves with all sections of the Account. The tour can be ended at any time by clicking the corresponding button and can be returned to later in the "Explore" section.
Personal Account Elements
If a non-verified account was used for authorization, an informational banner will be displayed at the top of the page indicating the period within which the email address provided during registration must be confirmed:
If the user does not confirm the account within the specified period, the profile will be blocked.
The Account interface is organized so that the main control elements are located in the page header and the
side panel
. The header contains:
— the company logo, clicking which returns to the Account main page;
"License Management" – a section for viewing, purchasing, and managing licenses that allow expanding the capabilities of using the GreenData Low-code platform (see the
"SaaS Licensing"
article for details);
"Projects and Invitations" – a section for viewing the user’s project list and organizing collaboration on a project by sending and accepting invitations (see the
"Projects and Applications"
article for details);
"Mobile Applications" – a section for creating and publishing your own mobile applications in the
Google Play
and
App Store
stores (see the
"Mobile Applications"
article for details);
"Explore" – a section for viewing onboarding tours; by clicking the corresponding buttons, user can restart the onboarding from the beginning or continue the demonstration from the step previously interrupted by clicking the "Skip" button;
the user account, through whose context menu user can:
navigate to
user profile
settings;
open the GreenData
Marketplace
with a catalog of ready-made products for solving various tasks;
open the
documentation
containing up-to-date information about the GreenData platform’s capabilities and settings;
open the
forum
to communicate with other users and find answers to common questions related to working on the GreenData platform;
log out of the current user profile;
the Account interface language – the language in which the Account is displayed (Russian, English, or French can be selected).
Projects and applications are created in the sidebar located on the left side of the personal account.
This panel provides convenient access to all available user projects and applications (for more details, see the
"Projects and Applications"
article).
To manage project/application settings, select it from the sidebar list. To open an application, click the
button located next to the application.
For detailed information about offered services, it is recommended to contact a sales department specialist. To reach technical support, use the online chat (for more details, see the
"Feedback"
article).
Additional Capabilities
Three days after creating the first application, the user will be prompted to fill out a form to get the ability to create a second free application.
If the form is not filled out, the reminder will reappear in the Account with increasing frequency: after a week, then after two weeks, and subsequently every 14 days, until the questionnaire is completed.
After the two-week trial period, if no paid
licenses
are acquired, the user will be offered to expand capabilities by purchasing a "Standart" license.
A notification highlighting the benefits and offering the option to purchase a license via tariff configuration will be displayed in the Account daily until the first paid license is acquired.
